title: اختبار قواعد اللغة الإنجليزية
description: A grammar test covering past, present, and future tenses for 10-year-old students.

questions.text: Which sentence is in the present tense?
questions.explanation: 'I play soccer every day' is in the simple present tense, showing a regular action.

questions.text: Which sentence is in the past tense?
questions.explanation: 'She went to school' is in the simple past tense. 'Went' is the past form of 'go'.

questions.text: Which sentence is in the future tense?
questions.explanation: 'I will eat breakfast' uses 'will' to show future action.

questions.text: Choose the correct present tense verb: She _______ to music every evening.
questions.explanation: With 'she' (third person singular), we add 's' to the verb in simple present tense.

questions.text: Choose the correct past tense verb: Yesterday, I _______ my homework.
questions.explanation: 'Finished' is the correct past tense form of 'finish'.

questions.text: We add 'will' before the verb to make future tense.
questions.explanation: Yes, 'will + base verb' is used to form simple future tense.

questions.text: Which sentence shows a daily routine?
answers: I visited my grandma last week.
I will visit my grandma next week.
I visit my grandma every Sunday.
questions.correctAnswer: I visit my grandma every Sunday.
questions.explanation: Simple present tense is used for habits and routines.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'run'?
questions.explanation: 'Ran' is the irregular past tense form of 'run'.

questions.text: Which sentence is correct for future plans?
answers: I am going to visit the zoo tomorrow.
I am visiting the zoo yesterday.
questions.correctAnswer: I am going to visit the zoo tomorrow.
questions.explanation: 'Going to' is used for future plans and intentions.

questions.text: Choose the correct verb: They _______ football right now.
questions.explanation: 'Are playing' is present continuous tense for actions happening now.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'eat'?
questions.explanation: 'Ate' is the irregular past tense form of 'eat'.

questions.text: Which sentence talks about tomorrow?
questions.explanation: 'Will do' indicates future action for tomorrow.

questions.text: We always add 's' to verbs when using 'he', 'she', or 'it' in present tense.
questions.explanation: Yes, for third person singular (he, she, it), we add 's' to the verb in simple present tense.

questions.text: Which sentence is in the past continuous tense?
questions.explanation: 'Was playing' is past continuous tense for actions in progress in the past.

questions.text: What is the future tense of 'go'?
questions.explanation: 'Will go' is the future tense form.

questions.text: Choose the correct present tense: My brother _______ TV every night.
questions.explanation: With 'my brother' (third person singular), we use 'watches'.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'write'?
questions.explanation: 'Wrote' is the irregular past tense form of 'write'.

questions.text: Which sentence shows a future prediction?
questions.explanation: 'Will' is often used for predictions about the future.

questions.text: All regular past tense verbs end with 'ed'.
questions.explanation: Yes, regular verbs form their past tense by adding 'ed'.

questions.text: Which sentence is in present continuous tense?
questions.explanation: 'Am reading' is present continuous for actions happening now.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'sing'?
questions.explanation: 'Sang' is the irregular past tense form of 'sing'.

questions.text: Which sentence uses 'going to' for future?
answers: I am going to the store.
I am going to buy some milk.
questions.correctAnswer: I am going to buy some milk.
questions.explanation: 'Going to + verb' is used for future plans and intentions.

questions.text: Choose the correct verb: The sun _______ in the east.
questions.explanation: Simple present is used for general truths and facts.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'take'?
questions.explanation: 'Took' is the irregular past tense form of 'take'.

questions.text: We can use 'will' to make promises about the future.
questions.explanation: Yes, 'will' is often used for promises, offers, and decisions made at the moment.

questions.text: Which sentence describes a current action?
questions.explanation: Present continuous ('is dancing') describes actions happening at the moment.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'drink'?
questions.explanation: 'Drank' is the irregular past tense form of 'drink'.

questions.text: Which sentence is about next week?
answers: I will study English next week.
questions.correctAnswer: I will study English next week.
questions.explanation: 'Will study' with 'next week' clearly indicates future time.

questions.text: Choose the correct present tense: Birds _______ in the sky.
questions.explanation: With plural subject 'birds', we use the base form 'fly'.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'think'?
questions.explanation: 'Thought' is the irregular past tense form of 'think'.

questions.text: Present continuous tense always uses 'am', 'is', or 'are' + verb + 'ing'.
questions.explanation: Yes, present continuous is formed with am/is/are + verb-ing.

questions.text: Which sentence describes a completed action?
answers: I finish my work at 5 PM.
I finished my work an hour ago.
I will finish my work soon.
questions.correctAnswer: I finished my work an hour ago.
questions.explanation: Simple past tense describes completed actions in the past.

questions.text: What is the future form of 'be'?
questions.explanation: 'Will be' is the future tense of the verb 'be'.

questions.text: Choose the correct verb: Water _______ at 100 degrees Celsius.
questions.explanation: Simple present is used for scientific facts.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'bring'?
questions.explanation: 'Brought' is the irregular past tense form of 'bring'.

questions.text: Which sentence uses future tense correctly?
answers: I am go to the park tomorrow.
I will goes to the park tomorrow.
I will go to the park tomorrow.
I going to the park tomorrow.
questions.correctAnswer: I will go to the park tomorrow.
questions.explanation: 'Will' is followed by the base form of the verb 'go'.

questions.text: The word 'yesterday' is usually used with past tense.
questions.explanation: Yes, 'yesterday' indicates past time and is used with past tense verbs.

questions.text: Which sentence is in simple present tense?
questions.explanation: Simple present describes habits and regular activities.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'catch'?
questions.explanation: 'Caught' is the irregular past tense form of 'catch'.

questions.text: Which time word is used with future tense?
questions.explanation: 'Tomorrow' indicates future time and is used with future tense.

questions.text: Choose the correct present tense: My friends _______ to school by bus.
questions.explanation: With plural subject 'my friends', we use the base form 'go'.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'teach'?
questions.explanation: 'Taught' is the irregular past tense form of 'teach'.

questions.text: We use 'will not' or 'won't' for negative future sentences.
questions.explanation: Yes, 'will not' or the contraction 'won't' is used for negative future statements.

questions.text: Which sentence shows a fact?
questions.explanation: Simple present can state current facts or situations.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'buy'?
questions.explanation: 'Bought' is the irregular past tense form of 'buy'.

questions.text: Which sentence is about a future arrangement?
answers: I am meeting my friend at 3 PM.
I meet my friend every day.
questions.correctAnswer: I am meeting my friend at 3 PM.
questions.explanation: Present continuous can be used for fixed future arrangements.

questions.text: Choose the correct verb: The baby _______ right now.
questions.explanation: 'Is sleeping' is present continuous for actions happening now.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'find'?
questions.explanation: 'Found' is the irregular past tense form of 'find'.

questions.text: The words 'always', 'usually', and 'often' are often used with present tense.
questions.explanation: These frequency adverbs are commonly used with simple present tense for habits.

questions.text: Which sentence describes a past habit?
answers: I walked to school when I was young.
questions.correctAnswer: I walked to school when I was young.
questions.explanation: Simple past can describe past habits or routines.

questions.text: What is the future tense of 'have'?
questions.explanation: 'Will have' is the future tense form.

questions.text: Choose the correct present tense: Cats _______ milk.
questions.explanation: With plural subject 'cats', we use the base form 'like'.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'swim'?
questions.explanation: 'Swam' is the irregular past tense form of 'swim'.

questions.text: Which sentence uses 'will' for a spontaneous decision?
answers: I will help you with that.
The sun will rise at 6 AM.
questions.correctAnswer: I will help you with that.
questions.explanation: 'Will' is often used for decisions made at the moment of speaking.

questions.text: Regular verbs like 'walk' become 'walked' in past tense.
questions.explanation: Yes, regular verbs form past tense by adding '-ed'.

questions.text: Which sentence is in present tense?
answers: The students studied for the test.
The students are studying for the test.
The students will study for the test.
The students were studying for the test.
questions.correctAnswer: The students are studying for the test.
questions.explanation: 'Are studying' is present continuous tense.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'draw'?
questions.explanation: 'Drew' is the irregular past tense form of 'draw'.

questions.text: Which time expression is used with future tense?
questions.explanation: 'Next year' indicates future time.

questions.text: Choose the correct verb: My sister _______ her teeth twice a day.
questions.explanation: With 'my sister' (third person singular), we use 'brushes'.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'speak'?
questions.explanation: 'Spoke' is the irregular past tense form of 'speak'.

questions.text: We can use present continuous tense to talk about future plans.
questions.explanation: Yes, present continuous can be used for definite future arrangements.

questions.text: Which sentence describes a general truth?
questions.explanation: Simple present states general truths and facts.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'build'?
questions.explanation: 'Built' is the irregular past tense form of 'build'.

questions.text: Which sentence uses future tense with 'going to'?
answers: I am going to the store.
I am going to buy groceries.
questions.correctAnswer: I am going to buy groceries.
questions.explanation: 'Going to + verb' expresses future intention or plan.

questions.text: Choose the correct present tense: The Earth _______ around the Sun.
questions.explanation: Simple present is used for scientific facts.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'choose'?
questions.explanation: 'Chose' is the irregular past tense form of 'choose'.

questions.text: All verbs in English follow the same pattern for past tense.
questions.explanation: No, there are regular verbs (add -ed) and irregular verbs (change form).

questions.text: Which sentence is in simple present tense?
answers: I will read a book later.
questions.explanation: Simple present describes general preferences and habits.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'drive'?
questions.explanation: 'Drove' is the irregular past tense form of 'drive'.

questions.text: Which sentence shows a future prediction based on evidence?
answers: I will be 10 years old next month.
Look at those dark clouds! It's going to rain.
The train will arrive at 5 PM.
questions.correctAnswer: Look at those dark clouds! It's going to rain.
questions.explanation: 'Going to' is used for predictions based on present evidence.

questions.text: Choose the correct verb: My parents _______ in this house for 20 years.
questions.explanation: With plural subject 'my parents', we use the base form 'live'.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'fly'?
questions.explanation: 'Flew' is the irregular past tense form of 'fly'.

questions.text: We use 'will' for scheduled events like train timetables.
questions.explanation: Yes, 'will' can be used for scheduled events in the future.

questions.text: Which sentence describes a temporary situation?
answers: I am living in London for the summer.
I lived in London last year.
I will live in London next year.
questions.correctAnswer: I am living in London for the summer.
questions.explanation: Present continuous describes temporary situations.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'grow'?
questions.explanation: 'Grew' is the irregular past tense form of 'grow'.

questions.text: Which sentence uses future tense for an offer?
answers: I will carry that bag for you.
The shop will open at 9 AM.
questions.correctAnswer: I will carry that bag for you.
questions.explanation: 'Will' is used for offers and volunteering to do something.

questions.text: Choose the correct present tense: Fish _______ in water.
questions.explanation: With plural subject 'fish', we use the base form 'live'.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'know'?
questions.explanation: 'Knew' is the irregular past tense form of 'know'.

questions.text: The word 'now' is usually used with present continuous tense.
questions.explanation: Yes, 'now' indicates the present moment and is used with present continuous.

questions.text: Which sentence describes a past event with a specific time?
questions.explanation: Simple past is used for completed actions with specific past time references.

questions.text: What is the future tense of 'see'?
questions.explanation: 'Will see' is the future tense form.

questions.text: Choose the correct verb: The moon _______ around the Earth.
questions.explanation: With singular subject 'the moon', we use 'goes'.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'wear'?
questions.explanation: 'Wore' is the irregular past tense form of 'wear'.

questions.text: Which sentence uses 'will' for a promise?
answers: I will help you with your homework.
questions.correctAnswer: I will help you with your homework.
questions.explanation: 'Will' is used for promises and commitments.

questions.text: Present simple tense is used for actions happening right now.
questions.explanation: Present simple is for habits and general truths. Present continuous is for actions happening now.

questions.text: Which sentence describes a routine?
answers: I eat lunch at 12 PM every day.
I ate lunch an hour ago.
questions.correctAnswer: I eat lunch at 12 PM every day.
questions.explanation: Simple present describes daily routines and habits.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'break'?
questions.explanation: 'Broke' is the irregular past tense form of 'break'.

questions.text: Which time word indicates future time?
questions.explanation: 'Soon' indicates near future time.

questions.text: Choose the correct verb: Many people _______ English around the world.
questions.explanation: With plural subject 'many people', we use the base form 'speak'.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'forget'?
questions.explanation: 'Forgot' is the irregular past tense form of 'forget'.

questions.text: We use 'will' to talk about weather forecasts.
questions.explanation: Yes, 'will' is commonly used for weather predictions.

questions.text: Which sentence shows a permanent situation?
answers: I am staying at a hotel.
I will stay for a week.
questions.explanation: Simple present describes permanent situations.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'give'?
questions.explanation: 'Gave' is the irregular past tense form of 'give'.

questions.text: Which sentence uses future tense for a scheduled event?
answers: The concert will start at 8 PM.
I will probably go to the party.
questions.correctAnswer: The concert will start at 8 PM.
questions.explanation: 'Will' is used for scheduled events with fixed times.

questions.text: Choose the correct verb: Children _______ to play.
questions.explanation: With plural subject 'children', we use the base form 'love'.

questions.text: What is the past tense of 'hide'?
questions.explanation: 'Hid' is the irregular past tense form of 'hide'.

questions.text: The word 'usually' is often used with past tense.
questions.explanation: 'Usually' is an adverb of frequency used with present tense for habits.

questions.text: Which sentence describes a past state?
questions.explanation: 'Was' is the past tense of 'be' for describing past states.

questions.text: What is the future tense of 'come'?
questions.explanation: 'Will come' is the future tense form.

questions.text: Which sentence correctly uses all three tenses?
answers: I play soccer yesterday and will play tomorrow.
I played soccer yesterday, play today, and will play tomorrow.
I played soccer yesterday and play tomorrow.
I play soccer yesterday and today.
questions.correctAnswer: I played soccer yesterday, play today, and will play tomorrow.
questions.explanation: This sentence correctly uses past ('played'), present ('play'), and future ('will play') tenses.
